intro: Urophyllum heteromerum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Urophyllum heteromerum is also noted for its ability to thrive in coastal environments due to its salt tolerance.
